result.execSummary:
All charges against Chad J Apfel in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chad J Apfel is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad J Apfel

defendant.name: Apfel, Chad J

records.addlTxt:
(Clerked by DNeva)
11:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Julie L Matucheski appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Chad J Apfel appeared in court, Attorney Andrew T Knaak appeared in court for Chad J Apfel.
This covers cases 21CM208, 21CM209, 21CM210, 22CM11, 21CT09, 21CT20, 22FO23, & 21TR52.  Attorney Knaak relates and puts plea agreement on the record.  State relates. Court performs colloquy.  DE pleads guilty to count 2 in 21CT20 & guilty to count 1 in 21CM210.  Court finds pleas are knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently given, accepts pleas in both cases and finds guilty.  All other counts and cases are dismissed. Attorney Knaak relates. DE relates. Court orders:

21CT20 -
60 days jail with huber and good time, DE to report to Barron County Jail by 12:30 today.
$1,555.00 fine to be paid in 60 days.
16 month DL revocation.
16 month IID.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample. 

21CM210 -
SW.
 1 year probation.
May not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May no go on to any premises where alcohol is sold.
15 days conditional jail consecutive to 21CT20.
Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

Cash bond previously posted to be applied.
5 days credit on 21CM210 if probation is revoked

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on February 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
This cash bond is in addition to any other cash bond posted in other cases.
DE has until January 28th, 2022 by 4:00 PM to post bond.

01:02 PM Defendant Chad J Apfel in court with attorney Andrew T Knaak, both appearing by Zoom Video.  Defendant Chad J Apfel in custody.  Julie L Matucheski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This covers cases 22CM11 & 22FO23.  Both files set to 2/4/2022 at 10:30 AM before Judge Babler. 

22FO23 - DE pleads NG.  Case to track with 22CM11. 
22CM11 - Reading waived, NG plea entered to all counts.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.
